solution_line_template: The total ratio representing the age of the three siblings is {halima_ratio_part}+{beckham_ratio_part}+{michelle_ratio_part} = <<{halima_ratio_part}+{beckham_ratio_part}+{michelle_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}
Halima's age is represented by the fraction {halima_ratio_part}/{total_ratio_parts}, which means she is {halima_ratio_part}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_age} = {halima_age} years old.
Beckhams age, from the total age of the three, is {beckham_ratio_part}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_age} = <<{beckham_ratio_part}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_age}={beckham_age}>>{beckham_age}
The difference in age between Halima and Beckham is {halima_age}-{beckham_age} = <<{halima_age}-{beckham_age}={age_difference}>>{age_difference}
